body.p: Louisville, Jefferson County, Kentucky, cemetery. A workhouse and adjacent cemetery were constructed in Louisville, Jefferson County Kentucky in 1850 and subsequently demolished in 1968. The Potter's Field was a known location for obtaining bodies for anatomical research in the Medical and Anatomy Departments of the University of Louisville in Louisville during the nineteenth century.
